business_minor.description: Study the fundamentals of business including accounting, marketing, management, and economics.

children.description: Select 3 credits from list of business disciplines (400-level)
children.label: Supporting Primary

children.description: Select 3 credits from business disciplines or specific list
children.label: Supporting Secondary

criminal_justice_minor.description: Delve into the foundational concepts of criminal justice, as well as explore supporting topics and specializations within the field.

children.description: Supporting Courses and Related Areas (6 credits at 400-level)
children.label: Supporting Courses

dispute_management_minor.description: Explore conflict management, dispute resolution, and negotiation through communication and labor relations.

children.description: Select 12 credits from list. At least 9 credits must be at the 400 level.
children.label: Dispute Electives

economics_minor.description: Study economic theory, micro/macro analysis, and specialized topics.

energy_business_finance_minor.description: Integrates energy, business, and finance concepts with engineering and earth sciences.

english_minor.description: Select any combination of writing and literature courses relevant to personal interests.

children.label: English Electives
children.note: Courses used to satisfy General Education Writing/Speaking requirements cannot count toward this minor.

entrepreneurship_minor.description: Develop a foundation of knowledge to help take advantage of entrepreneurial opportunities.

children.description: Select 3 credits at the 400-level from ENTR.
children.label: Entr Advanced

children.description: Select ENGL 419 OR any 400-level Business/Economics course.
children.label: Business Writing Or Elective

finance_minor.description: Study investments, corporate finance, and financial markets.

children.description: Select 12 credits. At least 6 credits must be at the 400 level.
children.label: Finance Electives

geography_minor.description: Explore physical and human geography, environmental issues, and geospatial technologies.

children.description: Select 6 credits of additional Geography courses
children.label: Additional Geog

children.description: Select 3 credits of 400-level Geography courses (Note: Text says select 6, but list overlaps with other sections. Logic implies 6 credits total at 400 level including those selected above)
children.label: Advanced Geog

history_minor.description: Gain deep knowledge of culture, religion, art, politics, and war through the study of history.

children.description: Select 18 credits from the list below. NOTE: At least 6 credits must be at the 400 level.
children.label: History Electives

homeland_security_minor.description: Explore emergency management, security administration, border security, and critical infrastructure protection.

children.description: Select 9 credits from the approved list.
children.label: Hls Electives

hdfs_minor.minor_name: Human Development and Family Studies Minor
hdfs_minor.description: Tailor the focus of your minor by selecting courses that fit your interests in human development.

children.description: Introduction to Human Development and Family Studies
children.label: Hdfs Core

children.description: Select 15 credits. At least 6 credits must be at the 400 level.
children.label: Hdfs Electives

ist_minor.description: Explore the organization of data, networking, and the relationship between information, people, and technology.

children.description: Select 3 credits from application/web dev or management
children.label: Ist Electives Intro

labor_human_resources_minor.description: Study labor relations, human resources, and workplace dynamics. Note: 6 credits must be at the 400 level.

children.description: Select 3 credits of any 400-level LHR course.
children.label: Lhr 400 Level

children.description: Select 3 credits: Either 400-level from related depts OR from the specific course list.
children.label: Related Courses

media_studies_minor.description: Explore the role, content, and effects of mass media, cinema, and electronic telecommunications.

children.description: Select 3 credits: Cinema or Electronic Media Survey.
children.label: Media Survey Selection

children.description: Select 12 credits. At least 6 credits must be at the 400 level.
children.label: Advanced Media Selection

organizational_leadership_minor.description: Develop leadership skills, organizational theory knowledge, and evidence-based decision making strategies.

children.description: Select 6 credits from the approved list.
children.label: Leadership Electives

political_science_minor.description: Develop analytical reasoning and expertise in government, theory, and international relations.

children.description: Select 3 credits in Political Theory or Methodology
children.label: Theory Methodology

children.description: Select 6 additional credits from any PLSC category above. Ensure 6 credits total in minor are at 400-level.
children.label: Plsc Electives

children.description: Political Science Distribution & Electives (18 credits total). NOTE: At least 6 credits must be at the 400 level.
children.label: Supporting Courses

psychology_minor.description: Customize your degree with a set of courses matching your specific area of interest in psychology.

children.description: Select 11 credits from the list. NOTE: At least 6 credits must be at the 400 level.
children.label: Psych Electives Selection

security_risk_analysis_minor.description: Explore security risk analysis, terrorism threats, information security, and legal/regulatory environments.

children.description: Select Intro to App Dev OR Programming
children.label: Programming Intro

children.description: Select 6 credits from the approved 400-level list.
children.label: Sra Advanced Select

sociology_minor.description: Study human societies, social life, and specific areas of interest within sociology.

children.description: Select 15 credits from the list. At least 6 credits must be at the 400 level.
children.label: Soc Electives
